newsitem.title: USA: HA-LO says Montgomery Ward sales not predictable.
newsitem.headline: HA-LO says Montgomery Ward sales not predictable.

text.p: HA-LO Industries Inc, which distributes specialty and premium advertising products, said Friday sales under an exclusive merchandising agreement with Montgomery Ward are "not predictable."
HA-LO entered into an exclusive agreement in January 1995 to provide premium products to Montgomery Ward. In 1996, those sales were about $40 million.
Members of HA-LO management met with the newly appointed chief executive officer of Montgomery Ward this week, the company said.

HA-LO said it was informed that Montgomery Ward is aggressively assembling a "top flight team," which has not been entirely put in place. A senior vice president of marketing at Montgomery Ward, it added, has not yet been identified.
Until then, HA-LO said, sales under the exclusive merchandising agreement are not predictable.
HA-LO added that, based on operations in January and the first half of February, internal growth for 1997 with its other clients is expected to exceed the growth achieved in 1996.
Internal growth, it added, will be particularly fueled by HA-LO's ability to expand the business of two recent acquisitions, Creative Concepts in Advertising and Market USA.

Also helping growth are an exclusive merchandise agreement with Champion Products Inc, a division of Sara Lee Corp, increased proposal activity and new sales representatives, as well as a new office in New York.
Additionally, HA-LO said it expects growth to be furthered by its active acquisition pipeline.
HA-LO said its sales grew to $255 million in 1996 from $36 million in 1993, its first full year as a public comanpy.
"We are confident that HA-LO has the capabilities and resources in place to continue its growth," the company said.
